intro: Gnaphalodes filifolia, commonly known as the threadleaf everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale yellow to white in color. It is known for its long-lasting, dry flower heads that are often used in floral arrangements. Gnaphalodes filifolia thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and rocky areas.
